name: Conniption Bug
description: A small beast with barbed mandibles and claws, capable of grappling foes and leaping significant distances.
memorable: Its ability to restrain enemies even after death makes it a grave threat.
goals: To ambush smaller creatures and work cooperatively in packs.
relations: Often found with other Conniption Bugs or in similar habitats.
environment: Commonly inhabits areas near water, such as swamps or marshlands.
strengths: Excels in grappling and has pack tactics for enhanced attack rolls.
weaknesses: Relatively fragile compared to stronger monsters despite decent hit points.
attacks: Utilizes barbed mandibles for grappling and barbed claws for dealing damage.
most_powerful_ability: Death Trap allows it to deal damage even after being defeated.
senses: Possesses tremorsense up to 30 feet, allowing it to detect nearby creatures.
skills: Has an average perception skill, indicating it can detect its surroundings adequately.
additional_information: Can only breathe air or water if submerged periodically.
Standing Leap ability enhances its movement capabilities.
Scores critical hits on rolls of 19 or 20 with melee attacks.
It can grapple multiple targets effectively with its Death Trap ability.
Strategically dangerous when working in pairs or groups.
